sources.data_found: Hardware Configuration table lists GPU node types and counts: A100 40GB (8 GPUs/node, 2 nodes), A100 80GB (8 GPUs/node, 18 nodes), H200 (8 GPUs/node, 1 node), A40 (8 GPUs/node, 12 nodes), A6000 (8 GPUs/node, 14 nodes), RTX2080Ti (10 GPUs/node, 2 nodes), RTX3090 (4 GPUs/node, 4 nodes), V100 (4 GPUs/node, 2 nodes).
DGX BasePOD: 18 DGX A100 nodes with 80GB GPUs; also states 18 out of total 20 A100 nodes are POD nodes. HGX H200: one server available with 8 H200 GPUs.
States Afton/Rivanna provide access to 55 GPU nodes with NVIDIA GPUs including A100 and H200 (among others).

student_data.notes: On UVA Engineering’s “Undergraduate Enrollment and Graduates” page, the row for “Computer Science (BS)” explicitly lists: “Undergraduate Enrollment (Fall 2024) – 809” and “Graduate Enrollment (Fall 2024) - 248.” The page does NOT break the 248 graduate students into masters vs PhD enrollment, so grad_cs_count (MS-only) and phd_cs_count are set to 0. The page also states: “Fall 2024 enrollment data was captured based on census count on November 7, 2025.”

gpu_resources.notes:
Per-node GPU totals (nodes × GPUs_per_node):
- A100 40GB: 2 × 8 = 16
- A100 80GB: 18 × 8 = 144 (BasePOD; also described as 18/20 A100 nodes)
- H200: 1 × 8 = 8
- A40: 12 × 8 = 96
- A6000: 14 × 8 = 112
- V100: 2 × 4 = 8
Other (not explicitly requested as top-level keys):
- RTX 3090: 4 × 4 = 16
- RTX 2080 Ti: 2 × 10 = 20
No UVA-RC sources found indicating H100/H200 beyond the single H200 node; no P100/V100 expansions beyond the counts above; no L40S indicated in UVA-RC GPU node inventory.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
